football sex abuse Man quizzed by police in connection with historical sex abuse linked to Southampton in the 1980s 
Hampshire Police investigating a series of complaints as part of wider inquiry into alleged abused of youngsters in football By Duncan Wright 15th March 2017, 4:31 pm Updated: 15th March 2017, 6:06 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MAN has been interviewed under caution by Hampshire Police as part of their investigations into allegations of historical child sexual abuse in football. 
The 64-year-old man, who cannot be named, was taken in for questioning earlier this week as inquiries continued about claims of incidents linked to Southampton Football Club. PA:Press Association Police have questioned a man into historical sex abuse allegations linked to Southampton Football Club 

SunSport understands at least ten people contacted authorities late last year with reports of possible sexual abuse at the club during the 1980s. 
A Hampshire Police statement confirmed: “As part of Hampshire Constabulary’s investigation into allegations of non-recent child abuse within the football community (Operation Quantum), a 64-year-old man from Southampton has been interviewed under caution in a police custody suite. PA:Press Association Former Crewe coach Barry Bennell is facing 20 charges linked to historical child sex abuse in a separate case 

“This remains an active, significant, and complex investigation undertaken by specialist officers from Hampshire Constabulary’s Major Crime Team. 
“Officers still encourage any victims of such abuse to contact detectives from our designated Operation Marmion team on 101, or call the 24 hour NSPCC hotline on 0800 023 2642.” 
The news is the latest development in the nationwide investigations into historical sex abuse in football that emerged last November. 
Former Crewe Alexandra coach Barry Bennell appeared in court this week charged with 12 historical child sexual abuse offences. The 63-year-old faces allegations of seven counts of indecent assault and five charges of serious sexual assault. 
Bennell had pleaded not guilty in January to a further eight sexual offences. 
The charges relate to alleged incidents against boys aged between 11-16. 
Bennell has been remanded in custody to appear at Chester Crown Court on March 20.
